Interface Lockable

All Known Implementing Classes:
Account
public interface Lockable

Allows locking of object's so their methods will not function unless unlocked

See Also:
LockableBase

Method Summary
 boolean lock(int key)
          Locks the object
 boolean locked()
           
 boolean setKey(int key)
          Sets the lock key.
 boolean setKey(int oldKey, int newKey)
          Used to set the lock key when a previous key has been set.
 boolean unlock(int key)
          Unlocks the object
 

Method Detail

setKey

boolean setKey(int key)
Sets the lock key. Only can be used when no key has been set.

Parameters:
key - The new key to store
Returns:
true for sucess, false for failure. In most implmentations always true.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - If called when a key has been set previously

setKey

boolean setKey(int oldKey,
               int newKey)
Used to set the lock key when a previous key has been set.

Parameters:
oldKey - The previous lock key
newKey - The new lock key to set
Returns:
true for sucess, false for failure. False if oldKey is wrong

lock

boolean lock(int key)
Locks the object

Parameters:
key - The key for the object
Returns:
false if key is wrong, else true.

unlock

boolean unlock(int key)
Unlocks the object

Parameters:
key - The lock key
Returns:
false if key is wrong. Object will remain locked. Else true

locked

boolean locked()
Returns:
True if object is locked.
